newsitem.title: USA: Rexene dissident to appeal court decision.
newsitem.headline: Rexene dissident to appeal court decision.

text.p: Wyser-Pratte & Co and Spear, Leeds & Kellogg said on Thursday they will appeal a court's decision that denied their request to hold an early shareholders meeting to replace the board of directors at Rexene Corp.

Earlier this month, the Delaware Chancery Court denied the request made by the dissident shareholders for an earlier record date for a special shareholders meeting. The court supported Rexene's board of directors, which set a record date of April 18. The special meeting will actually be held on April 30.
Wyser-Pratte and Spear, Leeds & Kellogg, which own a combined 13 percent of the company, are trying to replace the board members in order to enter a deal to maximize shareholder value.
Huntsman Corp has expressed interest in buying Rexene for $16 a share and Wyser-Pratte and the other company have welcomed the offer.
Based in Dallas, Rexene makes thermoplastics and petrochemicals.
